content:
You're already crushing it with HIIT on the stationary bike! Here are some other HIIT workouts you can do at the gym:

**Treadmill HIIT:**

1. Sprints: 30 seconds of all-out sprinting followed by 30 seconds of walking or jogging.
2. Incline Intervals: Alternate between 30 seconds of high-intensity running at an incline (6-8%) and 30 seconds of walking or jogging at 0% incline.
3. Pro Agility Shuttle: Set the treadmill to a high speed (8-10 mph) and perform 30 seconds of lateral shuffling (side-to-side) followed by 30 seconds of rest.

**Strength Training HIIT:**

1. Dumbbell Swings: 30 seconds of rapid-fire dumbbell swings (using 10-15 lbs) followed by 30 seconds of rest.
2. Kettlebell Complex: Alternate between 30 seconds of kettlebell swings, 30 seconds of kettlebell clean and press, and 30 seconds of kettlebell rows.
3. Plyometric Box Jumps: Perform 30 seconds of box jumps (using a 12-18 inch box) followed by 30 seconds of rest.

**Bodyweight HIIT:**

1. Burpees: 30 seconds of burpees followed by 30 seconds of rest.
2. Jump Squats: 30 seconds of jump squats followed by 30 seconds of rest.
3. Mountain Climbers: 30 seconds of mountain climbers followed by 30 seconds of rest.

**Rowing Machine HIIT:**

1. Sprints: 30 seconds of all-out rowing followed by 30 seconds of rest.
2. Intervals: Alternate between 30 seconds of high-intensity rowing and 30 seconds of easy rowing.

**Tips and Variations:**

* Start with 15-20 minutes of HIIT and gradually increase the duration as you build endurance.
* Mix and match exercises to create a full-body workout.
* Incorporate different intensities, such as moderate-intensity intervals or active recovery periods.
* Add weight or resistance to increase the challenge.
* Focus on proper form and technique to avoid injury.
* Warm up with 5-10 minutes of cardio and stretching before starting your HIIT workout.

Remember to listen to your body and adjust the intensity and duration based on your fitness level and comfort. It's also essential to incorporate rest days and active recovery to allow your body to recover and adapt.
